title: elevates
author: elevates
content: We Indians would be celebrating our 77th Independence day tomorrow. Till the 75 th Independence day we had a lot of traffic on our local board and we were happy because crypto tax wasn't rolled out. Now my question is what do you except would happen whn we celebrate the 78th Independence day? Do keep in mind that we have Bitcoin halving and central election next year. I would like to propose that we as a community should have some kind of competition to celebrate this occasion. I would request active board members to have share some suggestions regarding it.

comments.author: Bureau
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on August 14, 2023, 07:14:53 AMWe Indians would be celebrating our 77th Independence day tomorrow. Till the 75 th Independence day we had a lot of traffic on our local board and we were happy because crypto tax wasn't rolled out. Now my question is what do you except would happen whn we celebrate the 78th Independence day? Do keep in mind that we have Bitcoin halving and central election next year. I would like to propose that we as a community should have some kind of competition to celebrate this occasion. I would request active board members to have share some suggestions regarding it. Nothing would happen as the central government election would happen in the month of November. Some of us do know which political party would again come into power. I feel that the upcoming government won't have a single majority as in the political party and there would be some amendments regarding crypto afterwards.What an incredible idea as I have not seen anyone creating a topic about Independence on the local board. I did saw Pakistani and Indonesians organizing different events for their local community. They are getting those events sponsored by those members who have been active for a long time. I would ask our merit source, Heisenberg_Hunter to rethink the next raffle and use the left over amount for a competition. There are a lot of religious events upcoming such as Diwali wherein we as a community can get our local board more action.
